meanings.definition: To suppress or ignore (an idea or problem)
meanings.sent1: She burked the suggestion of changing the schedule.
meanings.sent2: He always burked the issue of his overdue library books.
meanings.sent3: The way she burked the topic made everyone forget about it.
meanings.sent4: His silence burked the elephant in the room.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's dismissal burked any further discussion on the matter.

meanings.definition: To murder quietly or secretly, typically by suffocation
meanings.sent1: The villain burked his victim to eliminate any witnesses.
meanings.sent2: The assassin burked the target without a sound.
meanings.sent3: In the mystery novel, the butler burked the wealthy heiress.
meanings.sent4: The darkness of the night burked the crime from prying eyes.
meanings.sent5: The killer's hands burked the life out of the unsuspecting victim.

meanings.definition: To avoid or evade a responsibility or duty
meanings.sent1: He always burked his chores by pretending to be busy.
meanings.sent2: She burked the task of organizing the event by claiming she was sick.
meanings.sent3: The cat burked its duty to catch the mouse, opting for a nap instead.
meanings.sent4: The politician burked the question by changing the topic skillfully.
meanings.sent5: The student burked studying for the exam, hoping for a miracle.
